title: Linked List Fundamentals Quiz
description: Test pointer safety, dummy nodes, and fast-slow patterns.

questions.question: What is the main array advantage over linked lists?
questions.explanation: Arrays support direct positional access without pointer traversal.

questions.question: Dummy nodes are mainly used to:
questions.explanation: A dummy predecessor simplifies insertion and deletion around head.

questions.question: In fast-slow pointers, cycle detection works because:
options: Fast pointer eventually laps slow pointer inside the cycle
questions.explanation: Different speeds ensure a meeting point if a cycle exists.

questions.question: A common pointer bug in list rewiring is:
options: Losing the rest of the list before saving next reference
Returning dummy instead of dummy.next always
questions.explanation: If next is not preserved when needed, remaining nodes become unreachable.

questions.question: Given a node reference, local insertion/deletion in linked list is usually:
questions.explanation: Pointer rewiring near known node is constant-time.

questions.question: Which guard prevents null-pointer crashes while traversing two steps?
questions.explanation: Both fast and fast.next must exist before accessing fast.next.next.
